title: Edward Spencer (athlete)
text:
Edward Adams Spencer (November 5, 1881 – May 6, 1965) was a <a href="Great%20Britain">British</a> athlete who competed mainly in the <a href="race%20walk">race walk</a>. He competed for Great Britain in the <a href="1908%20Summer%20Olympics">1908 Summer Olympics</a> held in London in the 10 mile walk where he won the bronze medal.
He was born in <a href="Salford%2C%20Greater%20Manchester">Salford, Lancashire</a> but later moved to <a href="London">London</a> to work as a solicitor's clerk.
